name: Rocky Mountain Elk Guides
description: Premier guided elk hunting in the heart of the Colorado Rockies. Our experienced guides have been leading hunters through pristine wilderness for over 20 years. We offer both archery and rifle seasons with access to exclusive private ranch land and backcountry wilderness areas. Pack-in trips available for the adventurous hunter seeking true wilderness elk hunting.

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.text: Incredible experience. Our guide knew exactly where the elk were and we had a bull down by day two. The backcountry camp was well-organized and comfortable.

reviews.author: Steve R.
reviews.text: This was my first elk hunt and these guys made it unforgettable. Be prepared to hike — the terrain is no joke — but the payoff is worth every step.

reviews.author: Dan W.
reviews.text: Great guides, beautiful country. Didn't fill my tag but saw plenty of elk. Already booked for next year.

name: Big Woods Whitetail Guides
description: Specializing in trophy whitetail deer hunting in the legendary big woods of northern Wisconsin. We hunt mature bucks on over 5,000 acres of managed timber land. Stand hunting, still hunting, and rattling techniques employed based on conditions. Heated blinds available for late season hunts.

reviews.author: Chris L.
reviews.text: Taken a 160-class buck on the second morning. The food plots and trail cam data they use are next level. Best whitetail hunt I've been on.

reviews.author: Jeff M.
reviews.text: Comfortable lodging, great food, and knowledgeable guides. Saw several mature bucks but couldn't close the deal.

reviews.author: Paul K.
reviews.text: Third year hunting with these guys. They manage their land like a science and it shows in the quality of deer.

name: Thunder Ridge Turkey Guides
description: Spring and fall turkey hunting in the Ozark Mountains of Missouri. Our guides are championship callers who know how to work a gobbler into range. We hunt on 3,000 acres of hardwood ridges and creek bottoms loaded with eastern wild turkeys. Morning and afternoon hunts available.

reviews.author: Randy B.
reviews.text: Called in a double on the first morning! These guys can flat out call turkeys. Heard gobbling non-stop from the roost.

reviews.author: Tom S.
reviews.text: Fun hunt with skilled guides. The Ozark scenery is beautiful and the turkey population is healthy.

reviews.author: Billy J.
reviews.text: Best turkey hunt I've ever been on. We had gobblers in our lap by 7am both days.

name: Flyway Waterfowl Guides
description: Duck and goose hunting along the Mississippi Flyway in the rice fields and flooded timber of eastern Arkansas. We provide all decoys, blinds, and calling. Hunt mallards, pintails, gadwall, and snow geese over meticulously maintained fields. Morning hunts with optional afternoon snow goose hunts.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.text: Limits of greenheads by 8am. The flooded timber hunts here are bucket-list stuff. Will be back every year.

reviews.author: Brad C.
reviews.text: Great operation. Comfortable pit blinds, good calling, and plenty of birds. The afternoon snow goose hunt was a blast.

reviews.author: Luke P.
reviews.text: Stuttgart lives up to its reputation as the duck capital of the world. These guides know every pocket of water in the county.

name: Prairie Wind Upland Guides
description: Walk-up upland bird hunting on the vast prairies of western Kansas. Hunt wild pheasant, bobwhite quail, and prairie chicken behind well-trained pointing dogs. We cover thousands of acres of native grass CRP fields and milo stubble. Full-day and half-day hunts available with experienced dog handlers.

reviews.author: Ed F.
reviews.text: The dogs were outstanding and the bird numbers were incredible. We flushed over 200 pheasants in two days of hunting.

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.text: Great exercise and great bird hunting. Bring good boots — you'll walk 8-10 miles a day. Worth every step.

reviews.author: Gary N.
reviews.text: Well-trained dogs and plenty of access. The quail coveys were an added bonus to the pheasant hunting.

name: Summit Peak Outfitters
description: Full-service big game outfitter operating in the Frank Church Wilderness of central Idaho. We specialize in backcountry mule deer, elk, black bear, and mountain lion hunts. All hunts are conducted from remote spike camps accessed by horseback. Includes all meals, camping gear, horses, and experienced wranglers.

reviews.author: Rob A.
reviews.text: Absolutely world-class outfitter. The horses, camp, and food were top-notch. Took a 350-class bull on a pack-in hunt I'll never forget.

reviews.author: Dave K.
reviews.text: The Frank Church is the wildest country I've ever hunted. These guys run a tight ship and know every drainage.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.text: Five stars isn't enough. Third trip with Summit Peak and it keeps getting better. The wranglers and guides are family.

name: Lone Star Hog Outfitters
description: Year-round wild hog hunting on private ranches across south Texas. We offer thermal night hunts, spot-and-stalk, stand hunting, and helicopter hog hunts. No license required. Groups welcome with packages for corporate events and bachelor parties. Lodging and meals included in overnight packages.

reviews.author: Tyler W.
reviews.text: The thermal night hunt was unreal. We stacked up 12 hogs in one night. Non-stop action from start to finish.

reviews.author: Scott B.
reviews.text: Good value for money. Plenty of hogs and the guides worked hard to keep us on pigs all day.

reviews.author: Kevin M.
reviews.text: Fun trip with the guys. The helicopter hunt is expensive but absolutely worth it for the experience.

name: Northwoods Bear Outfitters
description: Guided black bear hunts over bait in the dense forests of northern Minnesota. We maintain over 40 active bait stations on 50,000+ acres of prime bear habitat. Hunt from comfortable elevated stands positioned over natural travel corridors. Includes lodging in our modern lodge with home-cooked meals.

reviews.author: Pete G.
reviews.text: Saw bears every single sit. Took a gorgeous 300-pound color-phase bear on the second evening. Lodge and meals were fantastic.

reviews.author: Brian T.
reviews.text: Great operation with well-maintained bait stations. The guides are passionate about conservation and managing healthy bear populations.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.text: My wife's first big game hunt and they made it special. Patient guides, comfortable stands, and an incredible experience.

name: High Plains Antelope Outfitters
description: Pronghorn antelope hunting on the open plains of eastern Wyoming. We hunt on over 100,000 acres of private ranch land with excellent buck-to-doe ratios. Spot-and-stalk hunting with some waterhole blind opportunities. Tags readily available with high draw odds. Comfortable ranch house lodging included.

reviews.author: Alan S.
reviews.text: Spotted over 500 antelope on the first day. Took a 78-inch buck by noon. These guys have access to incredible country.

reviews.author: Terry L.
reviews.text: Well-organized hunt with excellent access. The ranch house accommodations were surprisingly comfortable.

reviews.author: Doug P.
reviews.text: Best antelope hunting in the country. The sheer numbers of pronghorn on this property are staggering.

name: Heartland Pheasant Outfitters
description: Wild pheasant hunting on the prairies of central South Dakota. We have exclusive access to over 20,000 acres of prime pheasant habitat including CRP grasslands, shelterbelts, and food plots. Well-trained flushing and pointing dogs provided. Luxury lodge with gourmet meals and full bar.

reviews.author: Rich N.
reviews.text: Best pheasant lodge in South Dakota, hands down. The dogs were incredible, the food was five-star, and we limited out all three days.

reviews.author: Greg E.
reviews.text: Brought clients for a corporate retreat and it exceeded all expectations. Professional from start to finish.

reviews.author: Larry W.
reviews.text: Excellent bird numbers and well-managed habitat. The lodge is a step above most hunting operations.

name: Gulf Coast Deep Sea Charters
description: Offshore deep sea fishing charters out of Destin, Florida. Fish for red snapper, grouper, mahi-mahi, yellowfin tuna, and billfish on our 42-foot custom sport fishing vessel. Half-day, full-day, and overnight trips available. All tackle, bait, ice, and fish cleaning included. USCG licensed captain and mate.

reviews.author: Jason R.
reviews.text: Caught our limit of red snapper and a 45-pound mahi on a full-day trip. Captain knew exactly where to go. Boat was clean and fast.

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.text: Perfect family charter. The captain and mate were patient with our kids and we caught fish non-stop.

reviews.author: Tony C.
reviews.text: Great charter operation. Fish were cleaned and bagged before we even got back to the dock.

name: Pacific Northwest Salmon Charters
description: Guided salmon fishing on the Columbia River and its tributaries in Washington State. We target Chinook (king) salmon, coho, and steelhead throughout the year. Fish from our comfortable 24-foot jet boats equipped with heaters and fish finders. All gear and tackle provided.

reviews.author: Nick F.
reviews.text: Landed a 38-pound king salmon on the Columbia. Guide put us right on the fish. Can't wait to come back for steelhead season.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.text: Fun morning on the water. We each caught a couple nice coho. Guide was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.text: Good guide service at a fair price. The jet boat gets you to spots bank anglers can't reach.

name: Great Lakes Walleye Charters
description: Trophy walleye fishing on Lake Erie out of Port Clinton, Ohio. Fish aboard our 30-foot charter boat equipped with the latest electronics and trolling equipment. We consistently put clients on trophy walleye in the Walleye Capital of the World. Spring, summer, and fall trips available.

reviews.author: Matt K.
reviews.text: Boat limit of walleye by 10am. Captain has this lake figured out. Best walleye fishing I've ever experienced.

reviews.author: Dave L.
reviews.text: Good charter with consistent action. The captain worked hard to keep us on fish even when conditions changed.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.text: We hammered the walleye. Several over 28 inches. Port Clinton deserves its reputation.

name: Striper Alley Charters
description: Striped bass fishing charters in the Chesapeake Bay out of Annapolis, Maryland. We fish for trophy stripers using live bait, trolling, and light tackle techniques. Spring trophy season and fall blitzes are our specialties. Half-day and full-day trips on our 28-foot center console.

reviews.author: Phil R.
reviews.text: Hit the fall blitz perfectly. Non-stop action on topwater with stripers busting bait everywhere. Epic day on the Bay.

reviews.author: Sam G.
reviews.text: Good spring trophy trip. Caught several stripers over 30 inches on live eels. Captain knew the spots.

reviews.author: John D.
reviews.text: Solid charter with a knowledgeable captain. Caught fish on light tackle and had a great time.

name: Mountain Creek Fly Fishing
description: Guided fly fishing on the blue-ribbon trout streams of western Montana. Wade fishing and float trips on the Bitterroot, Blackfoot, and Clark Fork rivers. We cater to all skill levels from beginners to experienced fly anglers. Full-day float trips include a riverside lunch. Orvis-endorsed guide service.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.text: Magical day on the Blackfoot. Landed over 30 trout on dry flies. Our guide was an incredible instructor and made the day perfect.

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.text: Learned to fly fish with these guides and I'm hooked for life. Patient, skilled, and genuinely passionate about the sport.

reviews.author: Peter W.
reviews.text: The float trip with riverside lunch is worth every penny. Montana is paradise and these guides make the most of it.
